snippet: The outrage is gone. Today, it’s rare to hear a complaint about shows like “Modern Family” or the drama “Smash,” which has five gay characters.
abstract: Activists and academics say that depictions of gay characters on television play a big role in making viewers more comfortable with their gay, lesbian and transgender neighbors, even as gay-rights is re-emerging as an election year issue; the cultural battlefield of television has changed markedly since the 1990s, when gay characters on television were greeted with outrage by conservative figures and religious groups.
lead_paragraph: The outrage is gone. Today, it’s rare to hear a complaint about shows like “Modern Family” or the drama “Smash,” which has five gay characters.
